website_summaries.verdict: A beginner guide to programming that’s great for self-starters who want to break into the profession.
pros: A solid book on how to program in Python
Set of exercises at the end of each chapter progress nicely in difficulty
Author’s personal anecdotes of his career as a professional developer make the content relatable and a “feel good” read
The book is segmented into easily digestible chunks for readability
cons: Some reviewers didn’t expect this to be mostly a Python programming book

customer_reviews.title: Go for a better choice
customer_reviews.text: This book does offer insight but is limited in depth and detailedness. Without proper background you will learn the bare minimum of Python, Git, Pip etc. that is less than satisfactory. You will be better off with a few Udemy courses. The author attempts to prepare you for every aspect of becoming a developer while even teaching you to code. This is an impossible quest that results in a shallow book. Instead I would definitely offer "The Complete Software Developer's Career Guide by John Somnez.
customer_reviews.author: Gabor Meszaros

customer_reviews.title: Thorough, engaging, and well organized
customer_reviews.text: I started reading this book without any prior experience with programming. I finished with a solid, overview level understanding of the various skills and technologies necessary to work as an entry-level software developer. To get the most out of the book, I recommend: 1) Read the book quickly cover-to-cover, glossing over any confusing parts. 2) Read it again, more slowly, doing every exercise and typing/compiling every line of example code.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: This book gives much of the same information that other introductory books cover. The author focuses on Python and Git Bash version control. I was hoping for some new insights or new explanations but I feel that most the information found here is accessible elsewhere. It's not a bad first programming book to pick up, in fact the author explains some concepts quite well - but don't expect more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gawarecki

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Good for beginners. Challenges are very helpful to reaffirm what you've learned. Author uses color to help illustrate the code. I'm enjoying this Kindle book.
customer_reviews.author: ngyingka

customer_reviews.title: Overall a solid read for self starters!
customer_reviews.text: I am a self taught (mostly) designer trying to learn a bit of programming. I found the author's writing to be easy to read but also informative. I was worried that the technical nature of the book may cause the content to go over my head but Althoff did a good job of breaking down for us beginners. His personal anecdotes and accounts of his journey made the content very relatable and helped break up the tech talk too. Overall a solid read for self starters.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Horton

customer_reviews.title: Who Doesn't Love Coding?
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people claim this book, "Isn't what they thought it would be," but for me it's what I exactly thought it would be. You see, I've been coding for most of my life trying to find something that would work for me. So, when I say I like Cory Althoff's book The Self-Taught Programmer, I truly mean it. To me, space is everything so I will put this as best I can: you can learn Python programming very simply from him with this simple, small book. He gives you the tools that helped him be the Python programmer he is. I think that says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Liles

customer_reviews.title: Extremely helpful for learning programing and python
customer_reviews.text: Just started to learn python as a career change. always got alittle lost in online courses and verbiage used by different people (many different ways to learn programming). This book got be a sure fire head start, easy to read, understandable and great reference book if you need to review something. Would recommend for anyone from beginner to intermediate.
customer_reviews.author: McKay Montz

customer_reviews.title: TOO general, nothing NEW
customer_reviews.text: I am inspired by the title and some of the content is nice, but unfortunately nothing more beyond that. The topics bounce all over the place: Python, Linux, DOS, command prompt stuff etc. and there doesn't seem to be a concrete anchor for what the author is trying to teach. I wanted to learn something, and all I got was re-affirmation of good tactics. Perhaps this was meant to be one of those 'feel good about yourself programming books'. There is enough of that babble everywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: It help's to have some programming back ground.
customer_reviews.text: This programming is new to me and specially python I had trouble down loading python 3.5.1 because it was out dated I had to update it to 3.8.1. I had problems with some of the programming when I type it into the python shell some times it with work other times I with get syntax errors it won't let the program run. And I did it the way the book explain it so may be there something I did't understand.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel  Honor

customer_reviews.title: Great book for learning basics and new concepts.
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple years of experience in almost all areas of IT. One area I wanted to expand my knowledge on was the dev side. This book does an outstanding job of explaining techniques in a way a novice or someone with industry experience can understand. If I had the author as a programming mentor I would never feel like I wasn’t considering the best solutions to any situation given.
customer_reviews.author: Senor Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Python Beginners Dream Come True
customer_reviews.text: The self taught programmer is the ideal book for anyone new to programming. I've purchased a few other books on Python and have always struggled with all of the practice examples as they all pertained to solving mathematical equations. Cory is brilliant in providing examples throughout the lesson and then applying real world practice questions to compliment and test your comprehension of the material. His technique in presenting complex topics in simple terms that everyone can understand is really what makes this book shine. So why are you still reading my review? Get The Self Taught Programmer and begin your journey into Python and a new Programming career!
customer_reviews.author: Gbutler288

customer_reviews.title: Nice Book
customer_reviews.text: The book itself is really nice and informative. I enjoyed reading it. The only issue I had was the book came with a bit of damage. There were minor rips and a small indent on the cover. Overall I recommend this book due to the interesting content but be cautious about the condition it may come in.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: It covers some things but doesn't go into quite enough ...
customer_reviews.text: It covers some things but doesn't go into quite enough detail to jumpstart your career. I thought it would go into specific tools to use and explain where the coding world is shifting to, in terms of designs and languages. It did not really cover this material. I read the book within 15 minutes, because most of the chapters were too basic to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good book..
customer_reviews.text: Good intro to python. What have liked to have seen some practical and useful examples. I was able to follow and retain alot of basics quickly but this really covered only a small part of python programming. Otherwise still a good book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Book for Busy Self-Starters
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying this book, as it is broken up into easily doable portions for turbulent lives. If I need to review, there is no digging to find the information I need. I'm in the middle of changing careers, but still need to work. In the meantime, I'm working my way through this book, in the hopes of gaining a nice base of information in Python, and expect that I will keep it for reference, later on. The learning is in the doing, without a lot of verbiage to confuse you. The information is all there, though. I'm so grateful to have found this book!
customer_reviews.author: RegiDG

customer_reviews.title: I haven’t finish the book, however, I ‘ve ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t finish the book , however, I ‘ve learned a lot , about the fundamentals of programming. Surprisingly what i’ve Learned helped me unlock and figure out the likes of Excel data analytics and SQL 2014 T strings.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne B. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great introducction to programming and python
customer_reviews.text: Got me started with Python and worked great to geat familiar with the language. This will be a good base when starting working with machine learning in Python, instead of R and Matlab. I have been scripting Matlab quite a lot and was familiar with almsot all of the concepts since before, but the books worked as a great refresher of my knowledge. It also inspired me to do some developing and I have started playing with a raspberry pi, something I really hdn't planned when taking up the book.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Flinck

customer_reviews.title: Very good basic introduction to programming
customer_reviews.text: This book provides great explanations of core programming concepts and would save a lot of effort for anyone new to programming, even if they are going through a more formal course. I would like to a see a more readable typeface, and perhaps a few more charts & graphics in a future revision. The current layout is a bit of a detractor to the otherwise great content.
customer_reviews.author: Derek G Ricke

customer_reviews.title: Okay as a motivational speech.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for more, but this could be useful to students who are contemplating a career in programming / software development / etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the palindrome.

customer_reviews.title: Title should be "How to convert 15$ into basic Python knowledge"
customer_reviews.text: I was left feeling pretty mislead by the author making no attempt to forewarn potential buyers that the first TWO THIRDS of the book are dedicated to learning Python. If you mainly want to learn Python, but don't want to learn it from a video, or even the best "How to write Python" book, then you just hit the jackpot. If you do NOT want to learn Python, then you should probably not buy a book that teaches you Python, which I cannot stress enough, is exactly what this is.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy the book very much
customer_reviews.text: I am a absolute beginner so my opinion is that of....a beginner! I enjoy the book very much. It is easy to understand, well conceived and I recommend it to whomever is just that: an absolute beginner. Thanks to Cory Althoff
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Advanced beginner
customer_reviews.text: Overall the book is well written, and easy to understand; however, many things might be not that friendly for complete beginners. If you looking for your first Python/programming book to start this might be a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry S.

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately far from "definitive"
customer_reviews.text: Most of this book is an introduction to Python, with an added touch of command-line, version management and regex. The final section of the book deals with how to get a job and write code in a professional environment, but is very superficial and lacks concrete examples. If you've already had exposure to Python or similar languages, you probably won't find much of worth in this book.
customer_reviews.author: MatsKin

customer_reviews.title: Great book for those looking to teach themselves Python.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for. A book for those who want to teach themselves. This is probably not a good book for intermediates or experts but if you like to teach yourself and you are at the beginning Python level then I recommend it. The author explains things simply and well.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith, Esq.

customer_reviews.title: Great foundational book
customer_reviews.text: It was a very helpful book to help go back over the basics of programming at a high level. I had taken computer science in college but those classes never were explained as easy as Cory did in this book. I highly recommend if you’re looking to get a start into programming. It is not a full from 0 to Hero book but it will give you the basic ideas and foundation to begin practicing more to get to those levels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Taught me Python quickly and easily.
customer_reviews.text: I am currently working towards attaining a Bachelors in Management Information Systems and a minor in Computer Science, and I absolutely loved this book. It teaches python at a level that I've been learning other languages in school. If you are looking for a great resource to quickly learn a programming language, I would definitely recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: it'll change your life
customer_reviews.text: This helped me start a new career and making much more money than i thought possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Infrastructure Engineers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book as a network engineer with basic procedural programming knowledge (C and BASIC) and found it to be extremely informative and a great jumping off point to using Python and OOP professionally. It only scratches the surface but upon finishing it I feel that I’m in a great position to learn more and begin to leverage Python at work for automation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rotella

customer_reviews.title: Chapters are super easy to digest
customer_reviews.text: Chapters are super easy to digest. I like the clear and easy to understand language. I appreciate that practice exercises have the answers online, lets you compare your answers (how you would anser the problem) to how the author would approach it. Would recommend for all beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Jwhstman

customer_reviews.title: Good start
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this book, made complex issues that other programming stuff I’ve read understandably. Also liked that it was a modular read. Not looking for a job just a hobby and this was a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Savage

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book! While this book is written with Python ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book! While this book is written with Python examples, I think anyone learning to code will benefit from this book. The fundamentals are covered very well. These fundamental concepts transition across any language. I was looking for an introduction to Python and found this gem. I highly recommend this book to anyone wanting to learn to code or looking for a great starter to Python. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Erich A. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Unreadable on Kindle
customer_reviews.text: Warning: Code is unreadable on all Kindle devices due to poor formatting.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Very good foundation
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving it. It has been the best programming book I have read so far. Very simple and concise. Straight to the point. Super recommend
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Vinicius Costa

customer_reviews.title: Great book for beginners as well as anyone in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book for beginners as well as anyone in a programming class that feels the info is alottle above their head. Very informative and in layman’s terms.
customer_reviews.author: Kima

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic book, and is a must for anyone starting ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic book, and is a must for anyone starting out! It is simple, easy to follow, and will give you both the tools and confidence you need going forward!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Desssources

customer_reviews.title: For Ultra-Beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Well, as a self taught programmer myself, I thought this book would take me to the next level. You know insights into Cairngorm architecture, or some other architecture. It's ok for basic knowledge. I'm probably not the target market.
customer_reviews.author: Special K

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good start in teaching yourself to program but self-learning ...
customer_reviews.text: Got for my husband. Both of us share this account to pay for items. His input: It's a pretty good start in teaching yourself to program but self-learning is hard so can't say I'm seeing much progress as I'd want.
customer_reviews.author: Diandra

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This a great beginners book for Python. It covers the basics really well. True that there are many free resources online but the problem is that many free resources pull you in many different directions and can be detrimental to a beginner. For more intermediate and advanced topics, there are plenty of books that can supplement that aspect of Python and programming as well.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Very informative
customer_reviews.text: Code portions difficult to read on kindle. Recommend paper copy. Easy to follow and written in a manner perfect for self-instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S. Netherton

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé said this book really helped him and was easy to understand
customer_reviews.author: Marianna

customer_reviews.title: super easy to follow and understand, very organized
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of this book. I saw the reviews and thought I woudl give it a try... and it was definitely a good choice! The way he organizes and writes is very easy to follow and understand. I highly recommend this for anyone wanting to dive into learning about Python and programming.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great book for anyone considering a career change to programming
customer_reviews.text: Great introduction to Python and programming concepts. Cory is excellent at explaining technical concepts in easy-to-understand language. I wish I had read this book earlier in my path to becoming a software engineer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Domingo

customer_reviews.title: Full review post completion
customer_reviews.text: I have basic knowledge about python and decided to read this book to understand python from a different POV. But for now, a small error I noticed. @Cory Althoff Chapt 6: string manipulations, Challenge 5 solution - lst = "Where now? Who now? When now?".split("?") print(lst) gives out the wrong answer..
customer_reviews.author: Nataraj

customer_reviews.title: Many great tips that go far beyond the ‘behind the screen’ ...
customer_reviews.text: What a phenomenally well written, and entirely comprehensible book this man has written. Many great tips that go far beyond the ‘behind the screen’ part of programming. Highly recommend to anyone wanting to further advance their programming capability. Or anyone entirely new for that matter.
customer_reviews.author: OGnella

customer_reviews.title: Perfect programming book.
customer_reviews.text: For 2.99, this is one of the best three dollars that you will ever spend. This is a great book to start programming with, and for three dollars? It's a no-brainer. This books teaches you the basics of programming with python, and then expands into more advanced subjects, on top of teaching you about OOP, functional programming, ect.. Buy this book, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Plas

customer_reviews.title: Good info on learning to program
customer_reviews.text: If all you want to do is program for a hobby like me this book is a good place to start.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Great Content and Easy to Understand
customer_reviews.text: Cory has an inspiring story as a self-taught programmer. Being that he had to learn the self-taught way, he has an advantage in and shares his knowledge in a simple, easy to understand manner, even for non-technical folks. Though his coding examples are in Python, the same concepts would apply for other languages as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Good intro to programming
customer_reviews.text: Nice intro to Python programming and a sampling of the professional programming environment. Enough for the novice to decide whether or not to continue developing more advanced skills.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Indvik

customer_reviews.title: Must have book
customer_reviews.text: Very good book for the learning the concept of python programming specifically for bigginer. I did follow few chapters. Still working.
customer_reviews.author: Shamsuddin

customer_reviews.title: Great book for beginners or refresher
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book as a refresher. It is very well written.
customer_reviews.author: A&A.S.

customer_reviews.title: A good starting point
customer_reviews.text: Covers the basics well and provides one with links to other great resources. I would recommend this book to someone who is willing to grasp the concept of programming in general.
customer_reviews.author: Donatas

customer_reviews.title: Like a few others here I thought the book would ...
customer_reviews.text: Like a few others here I thought the book would show a path for the self taught programmer. I understand the need to get through the basics of programming. Was hoping, based on the title, that a path was laid out. Even if it was a general one. Think I would have enjoyed it if Cory had given his journey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, somewhat too elementary at times....
customer_reviews.text: A decent but average intro to programming. Good theory of how to teach programming. Not suitable for anyone but a beginner looking to learn quickly. Fast and not so dirty but honest.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for tuch ups of an already extensive programming language

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to work for it. This book will ...
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to work for it. This book will walk you through building a small game and teaching you how to work with Python.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: The essentials of Python and a wise, practical guide
customer_reviews.text: The author has gotten across programming concepts and priorities that will help this amateur to work smarter. Anyone contemplating becoming a full time career programmer will find invaluable guidance.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart C. Marmorstein

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book reckoning that it's for all programming languages but it's only for Python, If you want to comprehend python this book can be extremely advantageous. The author has done a great job laying down numerous methods for cracking problems.
customer_reviews.author: nabeel gill

customer_reviews.title: A great book, recommended for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the best book to learn the basics of programming and build a solid foundation. I love the colored pages as they attract your attention.
customer_reviews.author: Rutul Parikh

customer_reviews.title: This book is an incredible resource to have for any ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is an incredible resource to have for any beginning programmer. The methods and practices provided are extremely helpful and truly give one a path towards starting a career in programming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I’ve ever made
customer_reviews.text: The future is here, and learning to code was the best decision I’ve made in regards to my present career - thank you Cory - for writing an amazing book on teaching yourself how to code. I’ve been able to do things I had only dreamed of before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good starter book!
customer_reviews.text: Would read here & there, more focused on other obligations but definitely worth the buy to get started with programming, even bought my brother one!

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Thorough!
customer_reviews.text: This book is REALLY nice for people new to python! The only thing, however, is that Some of the examples in the book are wrong. (I noticed this after I looked at the same examples in the kindle version and saw the difference)
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: Very good book about Programming
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This book cover all the basics and advance topics about programming on Python. 100% recommended. I learn very interesting stuff from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Pichardo

customer_reviews.title: Good for absolute self thought beginners!
customer_reviews.text: If you are self thought and also striving to understand and survive the environment of what it takes to be a professional python programmer. Then get this book. There are additional directives to resources that will get you to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: TEN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! It was very well written and goes over ideas, not just a programming language.

customer_reviews.title: Great read

customer_reviews.title: A Beginner's Bible to Take You to Mastery
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those books you'll have to read or reference more than once but it's a perfect book for Python or Beginner/Aspiring programmers.

customer_reviews.text: This was very useful resource to learn coding at home

customer_reviews.title: Brief overview of Python basics; not much depth
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for more career-related advice, but this book is mostly an introduction to basic Python programming. If you already have some experience with Python, this book isn't necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T. Fricke

customer_reviews.title: Some inconsistency
customer_reviews.text: I am at the loops chapter and it is not properly formulated. I am worried for when I reach complex topics.

customer_reviews.title: good approach to beginners
customer_reviews.text: I think this book contains a good approach to beginners without special school formation that want to begin programming

customer_reviews.title: VERY good!

All in small chunks. A Great read end to end or review/refresher as a per topic reference..(my use case). Enjoyed it much..

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: This book worked for me. Well written. Useful examples and exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Bright

customer_reviews.title: Practice every day
customer_reviews.text: Theres a lot to learn, you need to build on what you learn and keep practicing. Read a lot code and try thinking like a programmer for each problem.

customer_reviews.text: Good basic knowledge, did the job for me, again its very basic but good, youll practice with python and other tools!!

customer_reviews.text: There is a clarity and conciseness in his writing that makes this book easy and fun to follow, and as a guy starting out I find that very comforting!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, good examples, like the structure of the book.

customer_reviews.text: Solid book if you don't know anything but I ended up only really looking at the vocab to pick up anything I didn't already know.

customer_reviews.title: I did learn some Python.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a good book. I wish they had spent more time with the bash shell or command line.

customer_reviews.title: Good for total beginners. I skipped almost the whole book.
customer_reviews.text: I read only the beginning and the ending, all the stuff between has been skimmed and skipped. The book is good for beginners though

customer_reviews.title: other than that this book is good as highschool freshmen level of
customer_reviews.text: links are gone on some of the exercises, other than that this book is good as highschool freshmen level of reading

customer_reviews.text: A must read if you are trying to get a job as a programmer. It also teaches you Python 3.x, which is always useful.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro to programming!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. I'm halfway through it and have learned a lot. At some points you may have to stop and do further research to wrap your head around certain concepts(like functions for me), but it is a great roadmap for someone like myself who is completely new to programming.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Short, sweet, great guide for a total beginner.
customer_reviews.text: As someone with no prior programming experience, this book was a delightful first foray into the programming world. In nearly every chapter I experienced an "aha!" moment- a fact that definitely reinforced my enthusiasm while reading through. This book is segmented into easily digestible chunks, which aids in its readability and re-readability. You could read this book for fifteen minutes during a coffee break or you could whittle away an evening working through the post chapter challenges and, in either case, feel as though you had not wasted a second. The Self-Taught Programmer has helped to evolve my curiosity into a great interest- one which I cannot wait to explore further.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Ooops
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really get anything out of this book. I thought this would be like a story about the path to being a programmer. This was more like a simple Python tutorial with a little bit of scratches to other fields (version control, data structures, databases, bash etc.) Maybe a good read for a total newbie.
customer_reviews.author: Jarmo Annunen

customer_reviews.title: Must have for developers
customer_reviews.text: With all the information on the internet about Object Oriented Programming and the like, I find myself coming back to this book again and again for review. I have read countless descriptions of complex programming concepts and Corey breaks it down in easy-to-understand terms. I have an interview and this is the first book I used for preparation. Way to go Corey, keep up the great work!
customer_reviews.author: D. Collins

customer_reviews.title: An incredible jumpstart to learning Python and computer programming!
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend this book enough. It's easy to read and only provides the necessary information for learning the Python language and grasping the programming thought process. I've supplemented the book with tutorials from PythonProgramming.net and I already feel like a pro. If the thought of programming has crossed your mind, get this book. You'll be hooked after just a few pages.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: text cut-off on the right-hand side in kindle
customer_reviews.text: i don't like it because some of the text is cut-off on the right
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to Program Professionally!
customer_reviews.text: This book is a roadmap of the practical skills necessary to become a computer science career-ready candidate. While it can absolutely guide the novice to develop expertise, it's also valuable for current computer science students because it goes beyond academic cs skills and covers the technical skills that employers are currently seeking. As an additional bonus, the end of the book focuses on the job search process with excellent advice on preparation for technical interviews and how to get noticed by recruiters to score that first interview. I'm a career coach and will be using this book to prepare my clients for technical job interviews.
customer_reviews.author: Claire W. Rigodanzo

product_meta.title: The Self-Taught Programmer: The Definitive Guide to Programming Professionally
